com.foreach.across.modules.filemanager.services

Class ExpiringFileRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.filemanager.services.AbstractFileRepository
      • com.foreach.across.modules.filemanager.services.AbstractExpiringFileRepository<ExpiringFileRepository.TrackedResource>
        • com.foreach.across.modules.filemanager.services.ExpiringFileRepository
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileManagerAware, FileRepository

    public class ExpiringFileRepository
extends AbstractExpiringFileRepository<ExpiringFileRepository.TrackedResource>
    FileRepository implementation which deals out file resources that expire according to a specified strategy. This implementation takes the identity of a target file repository and wraps its resources with the expiration mechanics.

    When a resource expires it will automatically be deleted by calling FileResource.delete().

    This implementation is especially useful for temporary file resources where you want the application itself to handle automatic cleanup (for example by wrapping a LocalFileRepository as an ExpiringFileRepository). Temporary file resources usually have a generated file descriptor.

    NOTE: Developers should only register the expiring version of the repository in their application.

    Since:
    1.4.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme
    See Also:
    CachingFileRepository
